DOC.brief_summary: This study help determine effectiveness self-supervised , home-based Transcutaneous Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation treatment protocol maintain Overactive Bladder ( OAB ) symptoms improvement woman responder Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS )
DOC.brief_title: Use Transcutaneous Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( TPTNS ) Maintaining OAB Symptoms Improvement .
DOC.detailed_description: Conservative management OAB include ( NICE , 2006 ) : behavioural therapy ( bladder training technique , prompt voiding , time voiding… ) ; physical therapy ( PFM exercise , Biofeedback , Neuro Muscular Electrical Stimulation… ) ; lifestyle intervention ( weight loss , smoke cessation… ) fluid advice ( fluid balance , reduction caffeine intake… ) . Antimuscarinic agent recommend non-pharmacological treatment prof ineffective ( NICE , 2006 ) . However , result behavioural physical therapy show fall three month treatment ( Burgio et al , 1998 ) . Furthermore , less one third patient compliant anticholinergic medication 6 month , mostly due intolerable side effect , also lack efficacy ( Hampel , 2007 ; Kelleher et al , 1997 ) . Patients refractory conservative regimen candidate Physiotherapy Department peripheral Neuromodulation therapy form Percutaneus Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS ) . Although mechanism action still poorly understood , efficacy report comparable antimuscarinic agent , objective success rate 60 % ( Burton , Sajja & Latthe , 2012 ) , good side effect profile . TPTNS non-invasive technique , easily manageable patient , lack adverse side effect report use PTNS , bleed and/or pain site needle insertion . As technique self-administered , associated cost might substantially lower compare PTNS , involve repeat Hospital appointment maintenance therapy . This study help determine effectiveness self-supervised , home-based Transcutaneous Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation treatment protocol maintain Overactive Bladder ( OAB ) symptoms improvement woman responder Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS ) Participants assign one two treatment arm use computer generate random number table , assignment draw seal , opaque , serially numbered envelope . Participants recruit Physiotherapy Department Liverpool Women 's Hospital . Our primary outcome variable change 24-hour voiding frequency , number episode urgency , well number episode urge urinary incontinence . These variable reliably measure self-completed 3-day bladder diary ( Gormley et al , 2012 ) . As OAB symptom-based diagnosis , quality life ( QoL ) impact symptoms crucial aspect condition . We therefore use secondary end point score OAB-q questionnaire , patient-reported outcome measure ( PROM ) symptom severity well Health Related Quality Life ( HRQOL ) . The OAB-q show good content construct validity , well high internal consistency good test-retest reliability ( Coyne et al , 2006 ) . Bladder diaries OAB-q questionnaire routinely use Department patient start PTNS ( T1 ) . Collection data carry end 12-week course PTNS . Data obtain point ( T2 ) determine subject objective responder invite enter trial randomize one two treatment arm . During study period , assessment carry main investigator , blind treatment group allocation , 6 week ( T3 ) , 3 month ( T4 ) 6 month ( T5 ) . PTNS perform bilaterally , insert 40 mm x 0.25 mm acupuncture needle ( Classic Plus Sterile Needle , HMD Europe ) , three finger breath cephalad medial malleolus posterior medial border tibia ( SP6 acupuncture point ) . A self-adhesive electrode place medial aspect calcaneus . The needle electrode attach low voltage electrostimulator ( AS SUPER 4 digital , Pierenkemper GmbH , Germany ) , set pulse duration 200 μsecs frequency 20 Hz . The amplitude ( 0-20 mA , adjustable step 0.1 mA ) increase flexion first toe fanning toe see , tingle sensation sole foot report , always tolerable level . Elevation Intensity allow whenever patient describes fade sensation due accommodation . TPTNS also apply bilaterally , use two surface self-adhesive electrode leg , one place SP6 place ankle skin behind medial malleolus . Electrical stimulation apply TENS unit ( NeuroTrac PelviTone , Verity Medical Ltd , Hampshire , UK ) use parameter PTNS group . An experienced Women 's Health physiotherapist conduct PTNS session control group instruct subject TPTNS group stimulation technique . Participants provide telephone number contact research team case query difficulty use TENS unit .
DOC.criteria: Female . Over 18 year age . Clinically diagnose idiopathic OAB accord definition International Continence Society ( Haylen et al , 2012 ) give . Good response PTNS . For purpose study , responder consider subject achieve reduction number micturition per 24 hour > 30 % . Able willing give inform consent . Patients comprehend physiotherapist 's instruction unable cooperate . Pregnancy , plan become pregnant course study . The main acupuncture point use ( SP6 ) report induce uterine activity ( Hecker et al , 2001 ) . Presence relevant neurological condition ( cause neurogenic detrusor overactivity peripheral neuropathy ) . Previous history continence surgery . Women pacemaker fit . Women uncorrectable coagulopathies anticoagulant medication . Presence dermatological lesion ( e.g . dermatitis , eczema ... ) medial aspect lower leg and/or foot . No anticholinergic medication allow study period minimum washout period 15 day randomization .
